alert.note: Alert for Madison; Onondaga; Seneca; Southern Cayuga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 7:11PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Seneca, northwestern Madison, northern Cayuga and Onondaga Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 710 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Weedsport, or 10 miles north of Auburn, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Onondaga, Syracuse, Clay, Cicero, Auburn, De Witt, Lysander, Van Buren, Baldwinsville and North Syracuse. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 90 between 34A and 39, and near 41. New York Interstate 81 between 16A and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
